did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physdesc: This collection consists of 1 bound ledger; the front cover is missing and back cover is detached.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Hoak Ledger, Collection #4023, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Purchased in June, 2001 from Green Valley Auctions, Mt. Crawford, VA.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: This item came from the collection of a Lexington resident and is thought to have originated in Shenandoah or Page County, VA, where the Hoak family name can be documented.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: On the last page is written "Gasper Hoak his book." Entries are mostly in German script with columns of numbers. According to Mr. John Stewart, JMU Faculty Emeritus and a native German speaker, the German entries refer frequently to shoeing horses, repairing wagons, and sales of wheat and grain. One page dated 1803 is in English and appears to be a recipe for whiskey.
